intro: Alfaroa costaricensis subsp. septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern alfaroa, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. This subspecies is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
